senses.de: To start or create something like an organization, system, or place.

Tips.title: Creation Aspect
Tips.description: Focus on the initiation aspect when using 'establish' in context to creating entities.
Tips.example: They sought to establish a new charity for disaster relief.

Tips.title: Origins Matter
Tips.description: 'Establish' often highlights when and how something started, emphasizing its history.
Tips.example: The museum was established by private collectors in the 1920s.

senses.de: To prove or show something to be true.
senses.ex: The police established his presence at the scene of the crime.

Tips.title: Evidence Importance
Tips.description: Use 'establish' to imply that proof or evidence supports a claim or fact.
Tips.example: The study established a link between diet and health.

Tips.title: Formal Context
Tips.description: 'Establish' sounds formal and is often used in academic, legal, and professional settings.
Tips.example: The defense lawyer worked hard to establish his client's alibi.

senses.de: To bring about a certain condition or state.
senses.ex: The new law establishes certain restrictions on the use of public parks.

Tips.title: Enforceability
Tips.description: 'Establish' conveys the authority behind creating rules or conditions that are to be followed.
Tips.example: The committee will establish new guidelines for ethical conduct.

Tips.title: Resulting State
Tips.description: Use 'establish' to show that an action has led to a new state of affairs or situation.
Tips.example: The treaty established peace between the warring nations.

senses.de: To be accepted or known in a particular way.
senses.ex: She established herself as a leading surgeon.

Tips.title: Professional Identity
Tips.description: 'Establish' is used to describe how individuals or entities build a reputation or status.
Tips.example: After years of study, he established himself in the scientific community.

Tips.title: Long-term Effort
Tips.description: 'Establish' implies time and dedication went into achieving a recognized status.
Tips.example: The brand took decades to establish itself in the market.

senses.de: To move into a secure position.
senses.ex: The company established its headquarters in New York.

Tips.title: Strategic Positioning
Tips.description: In a business context, 'establish' often relates to strategic decisions about location or presence.
Tips.example: They aimed to establish a distribution center in each continent.

Tips.title: Physical Presence
Tips.description: Emphasize the physical aspect when 'establish' is used for setting up physical spaces.
Tips.example: The bank established its new branch in the downtown area.

Build.wordDefinition:
Build means to construct or create something, such as a building, a structure or a system. For example, "We are going to build a new house.".

Both words are applicable in various contexts, but build is typically used when referring to physical structures or systems, while establish is often used in a broader context, such as setting up new ideas, systems or relationships.

Create.wordDefinition: Create means to bring something new into existence, to make something that did not exist before. For example, an artist creates a painting, a chef creates a dish, or a writer creates a story.

Found.wordDefinition:
The words establish and found both mean to start something or create something new, but they are used in different ways.

Found is often used when talking about starting something completely new, like a company, a school, or a city.

For example: "John and Jane founded a new tech startup in their garage."

Found is used when you're starting something completely new, and establish is used when you're strengthening or making something official that already exists.

Initiate.wordDefinition:
Initiate means to start something or begin a process, like a new project or a plan.

It is often used when beginning something or introducing something new. For example, you might initiate a new project or initiate a new plan of action.

Establish is used to refer to creating something long-lasting, while initiate is used to refer to beginning something new or starting a process.

Install.wordDefinition:
Install means to set up or put in place equipment or machinery. For example, someone might install new software on their computer or install a new air conditioning system in their house.

Establish is typically used when creating a system or organization, while install is typically used when setting up equipment or machinery.

Plant.wordDefinition:
Plant means to put something into the ground in order for it to grow, such as a seed or a tree. It is also used in the context of placing something in a particular location or setting.

For example, "She planted flowers in the garden" or "He planted a spy in the enemy's organization."

Establish refers to starting or creating something with the intention of making it permanent or successful, while plant refers to putting something in the ground or a particular location.

Set up.wordDefinition:
Set up means to arrange or organize something, often for a specific purpose or event. It is more temporary and can be used in informal situations, such as setting up a party or setting up a temporary office.

Establish is used for creating something long-lasting, while set up is used for arranging something for a specific purpose or event.

Start.wordDefinition: Start means to begin something that hasn't existed before. For example, you start a new job or you start a new hobby.

quotes.Text: My goal is just to be respected as a man when I walk down the street with my family. I don't care what your job is, you're not gonna talk down to me, you're not gonna try to get a rise out of me. I'm a man first. And in establishing that, some interesting things have happened.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Kanye West

quotes.Text: Our single most important challenge is therefore to help establish a social order in which the freedom of the individual will truly mean the freedom of the individual.
quotes.Title: South African Statesman
quotes.Name: Nelson Mandela

quotes.Text: I would like to try harder to establish my thought and philosophy strongly and to go back to the universe with my love.
quotes.Title: Japanese Artist
quotes.Name: Yayoi Kusama

quotes.Text: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
quotes.Title: English Scientist
quotes.Name: Charles Darwin

quotes.Text: Man, the living creature, the creating individual, is always more important than any established style or system.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Bruce Lee

quotes.Text: Establishing lasting peace is the work of education; all politics can do is keep us out of war.
quotes.Title: Italian Educator
quotes.Name: Maria Montessori

quotes.Text: The most important thing for a young man is to establish a credit... a reputation, character.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.Text: All are born to observe order, but few are born to establish it.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Joseph Joubert

quotes.Text: You don't get paid much until you establish yourself in cinema.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Satyadev Kancharana

quotes.Text: I declare that I will establish peace in this world.
quotes.Title: Indian Leader
quotes.Name: Prem Rawat
